episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including a quiet zone in America where microwaves must be kept in Faraday cages, Ray Charles' adventurous flying experiences, a zookeeper's unique relationship with a crane, and Bill Gates' involvement in the potato industry supplying McDonald's.

facts.fact: There's a 300 square miles section of America where all microwaves have to be kept in cages.
The musician Ray Charles, who was blind, used to fly to gigs because he thought it was safer than driving. However, he also insisted on flying the plane himself.
There is a zookeeper in America who cannot change job because the bird he looks after is in love with him.
Bill Gates is responsible for putting chips in up to 80% of Americans.
